definition[0]: to send someone or something somewhere for a particular purpose
example[0]: Goods are normally dispatched within 24 hours.
example[1]: A reporter was dispatched to Naples to cover the riot.
definition[1]: to deal with someone or to finish a job quickly and effectively
definition[2]: to deliberately kill a person or animal
definition[3]: a message sent between military or government officials
definition[4]: a report sent to a newspaper from one of its writers who is in another town or country
definition[5]: the act of sending people or things to a particular place
example[4]: the dispatch of warships to the region
definition[6]: to send something or someone to a place
example[5]: Manufacturers dispatch vials of vaccine in large, insulated cartons.
example[6]: A rescue team was dispatched to the mountain.
